JobFullDesc: About the Role  As GM of Uber Freight’s Service Lines, you will own the operations, go-to-market strategy and growth plan for Uber Freight’s Service Line expansions - currently Refrigerated, Flatbed & Powerloop. These Service Lines are among the most recent additions and biggest growth opportunities for Uber Freight’s business. You will be accountable for partnering cross-functionally across the organization to execute on your strategy and will be collaborating closely with product and engineering to grow these businesses and unlock additional product innovation. In a way, you’re building three startups within our young company. What You'll DoTake ownership of the business and speak to core operational and growth metrics with the Uber Freight Leadership Team and key stakeholdersCraft and manage the strategy, hiring plan, and growth of our service line offeringsDevelop, improve, and scale relevant carrier sales and operations teams, gathering key insights and streamlining operationsFoster strong cross-functional partnerships internally with sales, account management, marketing, other operations teams, and product and engineeringCollaborate with product team to develop, implement, and automate critical business processes and toolsMonitor service levels and implement corrective action plans where necessaryAlways thinking about how to do things better, faster, and more efficientlyDevelop process and system improvements to continually raise the bar of executionBe resourceful, scrappy, and get the right things doneBasic QualificationsMinimum of 8+ years of experienceBachelor's Degree requiredStrong track record of driving results and business impact Experience managing an operations team and/or team of analystsDemonstrated ability to build and develop a teamConfidence in leveraging data to lead, to monitor KPIs and assess business healthStrong communication and organizational skillsThe ability to balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them wellPreferred QualificationsExperience in Logistics or TruckingProficient to advanced analytical skillsMBA or relevant advanced degree a plus
